评论详情: Lifetime Warranty?! I did not see that when I bought it, this is a huge selling point for me. I bought the insulated vest for: cotton instead of plastic, inside pockets for pens/papers/other work items, and durability.  I work all day, year around, in freezing temperatures and wear one sweat shirt on top of another sweat shirt, I measured my chest with all that on, but now that I am wearing the vest, I could have bought a size LARGER than recommended, as unlikely as I thought that would be.
Great fit

I use this for working outside and in a barn around horses, it keeps me super warm while still allowing me to have full mobility of my arms. I also like that most of the pockets have zippers so I don’t drop my keys or phone while working.
Warm and comfortable.  Great for working in cold weather.
Love this vest & only giving 4 stars because the sizing is large. Reordered a smaller size.
This is a warm vest, similar to the name brand. Heavy duty zipper, fleece lining, canvas outer. Great for camping or outdoor work. Loose fitting but looks great.
It was a great value and arrived in the shape I expected
Exactly what I was looking for. Those times outside a jacket would get in the way. With a flannel shirt 30 degrees outside, perfect. Fit was right in. Seems sturdy. Really have no complaints.
Really strong fabric, very comfortable

I was pretty excited to get my hands on this vest, as I thought it would be a great addition to my winter wardrobe, especially with the promise of warmth and durability that the description advertised. The material on the outside is indeed sturdy, but that's about where the positives end. First of all, the fit was a major issue for me. I ordered my usual size, but it fit much looser than I anticipated, and not in a good way. The loose fit makes it difficult to layer properly with other clothing, which defeats the purpose of wearing something like this in the winter. It feels bulky and not form-fitting at all, leaving me with less warmth since it doesn't trap the heat in the right places. The length was another issue. It wasn't long enough to provide coverage over the waist, which is essential for me when I’m wearing it in colder temperatures. I found myself constantly tugging at the bottom to make sure my torso stayed warm, which was frustrating. Moving to the Sherpa lining, it is soft to the touch, but it doesn't do a great job of keeping you warm for long periods of time. It feels like it doesn't breathe well either, which causes me to sweat more than I'd like, especially when doing light physical activities outdoors. It's not as insulated as I expected, leaving me chilled after being outside for a while. I also found the material to be pretty stiff, making it uncomfortable to wear for extended periods. The supposed "mock-neck" design didn't really provide any extra warmth either. It was short and didn't keep my neck insulated like I thought it would, leaving me exposed to the cold wind. The zipper quality also left a lot to be desired. It felt flimsy, and it snagged multiple times during use, which led to a lot of irritation. After a few wears, it seemed like the zipper would be the first thing to break. As for the pockets, they are decent, but not roomy enough to store anything more than a couple of small items. I expected them to be deeper or at least have some kind of closure to secure things, but unfortunately, they just had flaps that didn’t stay closed well. After a few uses, I noticed the fabric started to lose its color in certain areas, particularly on the sleeves and sides. The washed look was nice when I first got it, but the fading gave it a worn-down appearance much too quickly. For the price, I really expected better durability and performance. Additionally, the fabric on the outside doesn’t seem like it would stand up to the elements for long. I’ve had other vests with similar materials that have lasted me for years, but this one seems like it won’t hold up to much wear and tear. The Sherpa lining, while soft, is not thick enough to make it truly suitable for the colder months. If you live in an area with mild winters, it might work, but for anyone who deals with real cold, it just isn’t going to cut it. One of the things that bugged me the most was the overall lack of attention to detail in the stitching and finish. I noticed a few loose threads right out of the box, and that’s always a sign of poor quality control. The seams on the inside of the vest felt uneven, and the overall construction seemed rushed. I get that it's marketed as a workwear item, but it still needs to have more attention given to the finer details to ensure it lasts. It’s not just about the exterior; it's also about the interior construction and how well everything holds up after wearing it for a while. The vest's appearance isn't bad at first glance, but after a couple of washes and a few wears, it’s obvious that it’s not built to last. The comfort is also hit or miss; sometimes it feels alright, but other times, the stiffness really gets to me, especially if I’m wearing it for hours. The product doesn’t have that soft, well-worn feel that I was expecting, even after a few washes. I really wanted to like it, but after wearing it for a while, I just couldn’t get past its shortcomings. While it has potential, it simply falls short in terms of warmth, comfort, and durability. Honestly, I don’t think I’ll be using it for long, and I wouldn’t recommend it to anyone who needs something for real winter conditions or for those looking for quality workwear.

I love this vest!  It's warm, comfortable, and perfect for working outside in the fall and spring.  The material and construction are good quality, and I expect it will last many years.  Very happy with this purchase, highly recommended!

评论概述: HISEA Men's Washed Duck Sherpa-Lined Vest
评论详情: When it comes to staying warm and stylish during the winter months, the HISEA Men's Washed Duck Sherpa-Lined Vest is a top contender. This vest combines functionality, durability, and comfort, making it an essential addition to any man's workwear wardrobe.  This vest's sherpa lining provides exceptional insulation, keeping you warm and comfortable even in the coldest temperatures. The washed duck canvas material is known for its durability and resistance to wear and tear, ensuring that this vest will last for years to come. Despite its rugged exterior, the sherpa lining and loose fit of this vest ensure that it is comfortable to wear all day long, whether you're working outdoors or running errands around town. This vest is a versatile piece that can be worn on its own or layered over a sweater or hoodie for extra warmth.  As someone who works outdoors during the winter, I appreciate the warmth and comfort that this vest provides. The sherpa lining is soft against the skin, and the mock-neck design helps keep out the cold wind. I appreciate how well it's made. Comes true to size with room to wear a couple of layers including a hoodie under it.  Overall, the HISEA Men's Washed Duck Sherpa-Lined Vest is a practical and stylish addition to any man's wardrobe. With its durable construction, cozy sherpa lining, and versatile design, this vest is sure to become a winter staple for those who value both functionality and fashion.

This is a boxy vest with a lot of room around the chest.  It's built to be layered over a sweatshirt or sweater and I like that.  Best of all it has a lot of pockets, including two inside pockets, one zippered and one with a simple velcro patch.  It's hefty but not too heavy.  Best for crisp fall mornings.  Great for hunting or bird watching.

This Hisea vest will remind a lot of users of a major name brand's vests, and that is a very good thing. It's a very nice quality, and very warm. The canvas shell is solid and has good, deep pockets. The sherpa lining is quite warm and soft. The fit was perfect. I opted for the blue, and it's a deep TARDIS blue, in my opinion; a little more interesting than a plain navy blue. The only things I don't like is the bright white branding tag on the dark blue, and that the vest came with a lifetime warranty if you email, but every email I attempt bounces back. But the vest itself is incredible, so I not only give it five stars but suggest it. Great work wear at a value.

评论详情: The chest pocket zipper broke within the first 20 minutes after unboxing and receiving the fest in the mail company will not stand behind or offer a replacement. I would not recommend this company.

Definitely loose fit, but true in the shoulders.  This vest was large in the waist, but perfect length for me, and I wear 3X shirts all the time.  This water resistant canvas vest is lined with a nice, soft synthetic wool material for a lot of extra warmth.  The warmth this vest provides is amazing.  It also has pockets in the from and on the inside of the vest.  The stitching is really well done.  This is going to be a vest you could wear for many winters.

This vest is great.  The vest is very comfortable and perfect for the Fall time of year. If you pair it with a sweatshirt, you could easily wear this into the winter months.  We love that this comes with two inside pockets - one with a zipper and one with Velcro. The pockets are perfect for keeping your cell phone warm ( the battery on a cell will degrade power if it gets cold ).  The front pockets are roomy and easily fit gloves/mittens.  This is a loose-fit vest and the sizing appears accurate.  Comfortable and Warm !
This is a men’s vest but it zips on the wrong side, like a women’s would zip. Looks to be a good quality vest.

This is a nice vest, made with quality materials and manufactured well. The lining is very soft and comfortable, and the shell is durable. The zippers are very good with no flaws, and all of the stitching is very good. This is a good garment for the outdoors lover and overall has a very good, classic look.
It was a large and it felt to Big

评论概述: Quality vest that’s tough but fluffy & warm inside — perfect for your Yellowstone ranch hand outfit!
评论详情: Review of HISEA Men's Washed Duck Sherpa-Lined Vest, Mens Loose Fit Winter Insulated Canvas Workwear Mock-Neck Vest (Dark Navy, XX-Large)Pros:  * exceptionally fluffy and warm on the inside  * thick heavy canvas on the outside, perfect for raking leaves or other manual labor  * it has a mountain man look, so buy this for fashion if you want to channel a Yellowstone ranch hand  * standard hand pockets on front, plus bonus cell phone pocket higher up and 2 inside breast pockets, a very nice touch!  *Cons:  * XXL size runs big around the torso  * XXL size is a little short top to bottom… it barely covers my waist (I have a tall torso)Earns 5 stars because it’s heavy and tough, but soft and fuzzy and warm on the inside and has great pockets.

I was surprised that so many people complimented this piece when I started wearing it.  It is soft and durable, much more comfortable than my carhart vest.  Really nice quality, nice lining and comfortable.  Great value.

Pros: 1) Stylish and I could wear it to parties 2) Multiple pockets; few with zipper. These are great to keep valuable items 3) I am pretty sure it can sustain cold temperature 4) The cloth feels really soft
Nice and warm for colder weather without being bulky. Should last awhile too, medium fits well.

评论概述: was sent a small when an XL was ordered, nice vest though
评论详情: I ordered a size XL and was sent a size small. The material for this vest is nice and thick. It feels durable and decently made. The color is rich and just like the photos.

I should have ordered a large size, but I didn't know it's best is cut big. It's a beautiful garment, and very comfortable. Since it's big, I probably won't wear it a lot. It punches up around my neck when I sit down, especially in the car. I love the brush finish and the sherpa inside. It's classy and warm and comfortable.

This is a heavy, well made, warm vest, and is exactly as shown in the product images. The small is a good fit on my 5'6" 140lb frame, except that they really do mean "loose fit." You could wear this thing over a coat instead of under it. It fits me perfectly in the shoulders, waist, and hips, but the chest, collar, and arm holes are excessively loose. There's plenty of room for a scarf around my neck and still be able to zip the vest all the way up.  I do love the size of the inner and outer pockets, plenty of room for stuff.

This is a very nice vest. You can tell right away that it is made with rugged very durable materials. I love the sherpa lining because it's very warm and does a great job keeping your cire toasty. I ordered my normal size and it does fit slightly roomy but that is actually ok with me because it will fit perfectly with bulkier shirts underneath. This is a perfect vest for getting work done outdoors but also looks nice enough to just wear around.

This extremely warm vest is made of heavy canvas cloth and is fur lined inside. The warranty tag I included above is no surprise, give the obvious durability of this. Winter is almost here and I will need this on many days. It fits me well. I wear a medium and this will give me a little extra room for the times I have something heavy under it.  It’s perfect for outside activity and can be just the right amount of extra warmth in cold buildings. You can see the three pockets on the outside of the vest, including a zippered one for extra security. It also has two large, heavy pockets on the inside. One is zippered and the other closes with Velcro. Nice features!

This is a very nice heavy winter insulated canvas vest and it's so soft on the inside. It's a high quality made vest, so it will last and it's nice and warm for the wintery cold days. I plan on keeping this vest.

评论概述: Well made. Runs a bit large
评论详情: This is a nice warm vest, with a great lining.  There are plenty of useful pockets, a sturdy zipper, and turn down collar.  It is roomy, so the large size is big enough to put a sweater underneath. One inside pocket has Velcro fastening, and the other one has a zipper. And the collar doesn’t lay flat.

评论概述: Heavy canvas, this will stop the wind. ZIpper and pockets have issues.
评论详情: Some pros and cons to this tough durable vest. I debated 3 or 4 stars, ended up at 3 mainly because of the "backwards" zipper. 4 Stars for fit, durability, and warmth. PROS: - Tough durable canvas. A good work vest and this will definitely block the wind. - Inner sherpa lining is warm and comfortable, especially around the neck. - Metal zipper - Upper pocket for ID, etc. - Nice longer length in the back - Runs true to size, maybe even slightly larger which is great to accommodate a hoodie or sweater underneath. CONS: - For those who note things like this (like my husband does) - the zipper is "backwards" from what the zipper is on most men's clothing - i.e., the zipper pull is on the L side which is primarily how women's clothes are, whereas it should be on the right. - The opening to the front pockets is a bit too high and could be lower. I suspect the opening is higher because these are open pockets, and that may prevent contents from falling out. However, it bothered my husband that the openings are as high as they are.  SIZING: Ordering usual size should work. In the Large this should fit my older teen son who wears size Large just right, with some extra room. For reference he's 6'1" tall, lanky build. My husband wears an XL, Even though my husband wears an XL, this in Large actually does fit - see the pics with the review, that's him. If I was ordering this for him I would go with his usual size of XL so he needed to he could wear a heftier layer underneath if working outside in colder weather. For reference he's 6'1" tall, athletic build, about 200#, and wears size XL I shirts.

This seems like a great vest for working outside and keeping warm while having arms free. For reference, my husband is 5'10" and weighs approx. 215 lbs. We ordered an XL and it was a little big, especially in the armpit holes. It would be good for wearing over a sweatshirt, but was still a little too big, so we'll return it. Take note, it does seem to run big compared to his actual size. However, the quality of the vest is good. The material on the outside is very similar to Carhartt and the inside has a nice, warm sherpa. Overall, a great budget-friendly option.

评论概述: High end quality at a great price
评论详情: I work outside for a living. I only purchase work clothes that last. This is so similar to one of my favorite brands, Carhartt, and I am blown away at the price.  You could spend significantly more for similar quality.The Sherpa lining is warm. It is really comfortable.  This vest has 5 pockets.  3 in the front,  Including a zipper pocket on the left side outside, and an internal pocket on both sides, one has a zipper as well.  I can carry my wallet, phone, and whatever else I need to carry in the pockets.These are a bargain. Buy one.

This is a nice and tough work jacket that is well made with the exception of the zipper. The zipper locks up at the bottom and is opposite hands from normal zippers. So, I have to zip it up/down with my left hand. I wear XL with some clothing, but this XL is too big on me. They give plenty of room for big belly USA. Plus, there are plenty of pockets inside and on the outside.  Lastly, the vest is really comfortable and keeps your core warm during the chilly temps. Great vest for a great price!!
I am a huge fan of wearing vests or waistcoats all year round. This one is nice and warm and looks great.

评论概述: Nice Quality Sherpa-Lined Vest - Loose Fitting in the Middle
评论详情: I picked up this men's canvas vest because fall is coming, and I've been doing a lot of work outside lately. I usually prefer hoodies, but living in Minnesota, sometimes the weather can be too warm for them, especially when you're active outdoors. I was looking for a balance between a hoodie and just wearing a t-shirt or long-sleeve shirt.  The overall quality of the vest is very good. The fabric feels strong and is on par with other popular brand canvas vests. One thing I struggled with was choosing the right size. I have broader shoulders, and my measurements fell well into the extra-large size. However, I was also concerned about the length, so I didn't want to go too small. I ended up going with the extra-large.  The vest fits well overall; however, it's very roomy around the midsection. I don't have a big stomach or waistline, so it's roomier than I would prefer. The length is good, so if I had gone with a large, that might have been too short. It's definitely usable—it fits perfectly in the shoulders, is a bit too big in the midsection, but the length is just about perfect. I'd sum it up by saying this is not a fitted vest. It's something you can work in and have plenty of room without feeling restricted when twisting and moving around.  The fabric on the inside is nice and will definitely keep your midsection warm. I also like the deep pockets, especially the zippered one on the chest. I'm able to fit my entire hand in with it open, so the pocket has plenty of room.  Overall, for the price you pay versus the value you get, I think this is a good vest. If you need extra room in the midsection, this will definitely be for you. I'm 5'10" and weigh about 195 lbs. Most of my weight is in my shoulders, so as I mentioned, the midsection is a little looser than I expected.  Pros: - Good quality, strong fabric - Comfortable and warm interior - Deep pockets with ample space - Fits well in shoulders and length  Cons: - Roomy around the midsection; not a fitted vest - Sizing can be tricky for those with broader shoulders but smaller waist

This is a well-made vest,  fully lined with a thick fleece, including around the collar. I attach a photo of the interior with the vest draped over my office chair.  This vest is actually a winter jacket without sleeves. I am planning to wear it during what is expected to be a chilly Fall  afternoon while attending an upcoming football game. The outside is a very tough cotton fabric that appears to be able to stand up to the abuse that would incur from working outdoors. I will test this out in a  few days when I rake leaves. There is a small zipper pocket on the left front that is just large enough to hold a phone. I like that.  I have had issues with zippers breaking on vests that I have worn in the past, causing the vest to be either discarded or require an expensive repair. But not with this HISEA vest which, the attached tag says, offers a lifetime warranty
